Type Ahead Select

Required files

SCSS files required: _components.type-ahead-select.scss

SCSS files optional: _components.choices-country-code.scss

JS files required: typeahead.js

Type Ahead Select structure

The Type Ahead Select element uses the feature rich choices.js library to wrap an ordinary select dropdown.

A Type Ahead Select element is created using an existing select and the Type Ahead Select js module data-js-module="typeAheadSelect".

A Type Ahead Select element options are defined by the data-options attribute, which accepts a JSON string in the following format:

                        [
                          {
                            "value": "1",
                            "label": "One",
                            "customProperties": {
                              "description": "One"
                            }
                          },
                          {
                            "value": "2",
                            "label": "Two",
                            "customProperties": {
                              "description": "Two"
                            }
                          }
                        ]

Where value is the value of the option, label is what is displayed and customProperties.description is what is searchable.

A Type Ahead Select element default option is defined by the data-default attribute, which accepts the value of one of your JSON options.

You can also specify the css classes to style the outer and inner containers via the data-container-outer-class and data-container-inner-class attributes; applying the .type-ahead-select .form__field and .form__control classes, respectively, will give the Type Ahead Select element the same styling as other form elements.

Default Select

This is an error message.

Country Code Select

You can wrap the select, along with an input, in a div with the class .choices-country-code to create a country code phone number widget.

Note: you must include the _components.choices-country-code.scss file.

Select Markup Only

If you would like to run the component using your own javascript, but would like to use themarkup and css available in the toolkit:

One
One
Two

To show the options, you can add the .is-active class to the div element with class .choices__list .choices__list--dropdown.
